event: Possible Use of Caliber Cruise Missiles
description: Head of Main Intelligence Directorate, Kirill Budanov, hinted at the potential massive use of Caliber cruise missiles in the near future. This could indicate an expansion of attack geography and increased scale of fire destruction of targets, complementing the use of X-101 missiles.
original:
The head of the Main Intelligence Directorate, Kirill Budanov, said that in the near future Russia may begin the massive use of Caliber cruise missiles.
 
“In the near future, I think we will see Kalibr again, because the number of X-101s has decreased significantly... There are regulations, documents, decisions, etc. The first thing is to restore the fleet’s missile stock, because they decreased significantly at that time. They completed this task. That is, now they are technically ready for their use. While the fleet was accumulating its missiles, the Russian Aerospace Forces were using the X-101.”
 
It is curious that Kalibr cruise missiles are mainly used by ships of the Black Sea Fleet, which, according to Ukraine, is “locked” in an unknown location and allegedly cannot function.
 
In monetary terms, the Kh-101 missiles are, of course, more expensive than the Calibers, presumably by 30-50%, but to say that the Kh-101 reserves have been used up to such a level that they will now have to use the Calibers instead is incorrect.
 
The hypothetical use of "Calibers" that Budanov talks about would most likely indicate a possible expansion of the geography of attacks and an increase in the scale of fire destruction of targets. “Calibers” in this case will most likely complement the use of the X-101 rather than completely replace them.
 
Taking into account the fact that at least eight Kh-101 cruise missiles recently arrived at one of the thermal power plants on the territory of Ukraine, Ukraine should not expect anything good from the hypothetical use of “Caliber”. https://vk.com/video-66833222_456301570VK VideoVideo by Self-Defense of GorlovkaWatch Video by Self-Defense of Gorlovka 29 s from 31 March 2024 online in HD for free in the VK catalog without signing up! description: On July 27, 2002, a group of 60 terrorists breached the state border in the Chechen Republic. Major Sergei Popov and Lieutenant Colonel Eduard Ladygin led border guard units in a fierce battle against the terrorists, skillfully directing their actions and adjusting fire. Despite their bravery, both officers were killed in action and were posthumously awarded the Order of Courage.
original:
Category: Excursion into history.

HEROES-BORDER GUARDS

On March 31, 2005, by order of the FSB of Russia, the Hangikha outpost of the Argun border detachment of the North Caucasus Border Directorate of the FSB of Russia was named after Major Sergei Nikolaevich Popov, and the 1st outpost of the motorized maneuver group of the same detachment was named after Lieutenant Colonel Eduard Aleksandrovich Ladygin.

On the morning of July 27, 2002, a group of terrorists numbering up to 60 people violated the state border in a section passing through the territory of the Chechen Republic. The head of the Groztkhoi outpost, Major Sergei Popov, at the head of the reconnaissance and combat group, blocked the bandit’s path to retreat and entered into battle with it. Reserve units landed in the area, including reconnaissance and combat groups of Lieutenant Colonel Eduard Ladygin and Senior Lieutenant Ruslan Kokshin. Once the data was received, the artillery began to work. The terrorists, who had scattered, concentrated their fire on Ruslan Kokshin’s unit. Other groups rushed to the rescue and entered the battle from different directions. Major Popov and Lieutenant Colonel Ladygin skillfully directed the actions of the border guards, adjusted their fire and conducted aimed fire themselves, but they could not protect themselves from enemy bullets. For courageous and decisive actions in conditions involving risk to life, both officers were posthumously awarded the Order of Courage.#excursion_to_historystarshii_pogrannaryada

event: Russian Orthodox Church's Support for War Against Ukraine
description: The Russian Orthodox Church, under the supervision of the FSB, plays a significant role in supporting Russia's war against Ukraine. Priests engage in patriotic propaganda, provide moral support to military personnel, and legitimize military operations by claiming to protect Orthodox faith and traditional Russian values. They also mobilize believers using religious arguments and hold public events in support of the Kremlin's ideology.
original:
Forwarded from: Protiv
The Russian Orthodox Church as the basis of religious support for the war against Ukraine In the Russian-Ukrainian war, the Kremlin largely relies on religious structures under its control. The activities of these structures are directly supervised by the FSB of the Russian Federation. Their branch on the territory of Ukraine remains the so-called Ukrainian Orthodox Church of the Moscow Patriarchate.

Currently, the Russian Orthodox Church, with the assistance of the FSB, forcibly seizes churches and religious complexes not only of the former UOC MP, but also of the Ukrainian Greek-Catholic Church and the Roman Catholic Church in Ukraine. Priests who refuse to submit to the Russian Orthodox Church are subjected to moral and physical pressure from the occupiers. Cases of brutal torture of Ukrainian priests and pastors of Protestant denominations are also known. Therefore, the participation of the Russian Orthodox Church in Russian aggression against Ukraine plays the following role: 1. Patriotic propaganda: Priests act as patriotic symbols, supporting the idea of the unity of Russia and supporting military actions against Ukraine. 2. Moral support of the military: Priests regularly visit military units, provide "spiritual" support to military personnel and discuss military events, arguing them with biblical stories taken out of context. 3. Legitimization of military operations: the Russian Orthodox Church justifies the war by protecting the "Orthodox faith, culture and traditional Russian values". 5. Religious mobilization: believers are called to support military actions, using religious arguments and images. 6. Symbolism and rituals: The Russian Orthodox Church holds religious rites, prayers and public events (crusades) in support of the Kremlin's militaristic ideology and its military actions.

Under such conditions, the population of the Ukrainian National Socialist People's Republic should distance themselves from representatives of this denomination. Clerics of this organization should definitely not be trusted with the sacrament of confession. Ukrainian representatives of the clergy and believers will have to form church cells in the underground. For this, it is worth recalling the experience of the functioning of the Ukrainian church during the underground times of the communist occupation of Ukraine.

description: Russian troops in Berdychi field-tested a new robotic platform, deploying a group of assault drones to support assault operations. The drones, equipped with AGS-17 modules, fired hundreds of grenades to suppress enemy positions, demonstrating good results despite enemy fire. This combat use will inform future production and development of assault robotic platforms.
original:
Forwarded from: Colonelcassad
The first attack of assault drones in history. In Berdychi, which is now being liberated by Russian troops, a new promising Russian robotic platform was field tested.

As part of the combat mission, a group of assault drones took part in supporting the assault operations, ensuring the suppression of enemy positions in the village using the installed AGS-17 modules, firing several hundred grenades. During combat use, drones showed good results. The drones were able to continue operating even in conditions where losses of personnel and expensive equipment from enemy fire would have been inevitable.

The experience gained in combat use will be taken into account in the further production and development of assault robotic platforms. The combat use of such drones in Berdychi is actually similar to the first tank attack during the First World War.

A successful tracked base has great potential for developing a robotic platform for assault (installation of various combat modules) and support operations (transportation and installation of mines, removal of the wounded, transportation of cargo and equipment).

In the future, such platforms will take their place on the battlefield. Despite the fact that there are similar developments in the USA, Britain and China, it was Russia that was the first to use a group of assault drones in a real war.

The project is being implemented with the support of Boris Rozhin and Chingis Dambiev. The future has already arrived.

event: Operational Meeting at Crocus City Hall
description: The Chairman of the Investigative Committee of Russia, A.I. Bastrykin, held an operational meeting at the site of the terrorist attack in Crocus City Hall to coordinate and control the investigation. location: Crocus City Hall, Moscow Oblast, Russia
original:
The Chairman of the Investigative Committee of Russia held an operational meeting with the investigative team at the site of the terrorist attack in Crocus City HallChairman of the Investigative Committee of the Russian Federation A.I. Bastrykin continues to personally coordinate and control the work of the investigative team to investigate the criminal case of a terrorist act in the Moscow region.

Today, the head of the department held another operational meeting at the scene of the incident. It was attended by First Deputy Chairman of the Investigative Committee of Russia E.V. Kaburneev and the head of the Main Investigation Department of the Investigative Committee of Russia D.V. Kolesnikov.

A.I. Bastrykin was presented with reports as part of work in various areas, including expert and forensic support of the investigation.

The Chairman of the Investigative Committee of Russia instructed to continue collecting and analyzing evidence, focusing on the need to study the connections of each of the defendants in the criminal case in order to identify all the organizers and customers of the crime by name.

Alexander Ivanovich Bastrykin checked the work of investigators, criminologists and experts at the scene, including the conduct of investigative actions with visitors to Crocus City Hall. The head of the department was informed that the process of recognizing them as victims and issuing things and vehicles was currently ongoing.

Visitors to Crocus City Hall, as well as other concerned citizens, fulfilling their civic duty, contact the department, reporting important information that, in their opinion, may be important for the investigation. The accumulation and study of this data is carried out by investigators on an ongoing basis to establish a detailed picture of what happened. The investigation of the criminal case continues. description: Pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked an Mi-8 helicopter to Ukraine, was assassinated in Spain. original:
Forwarded from: Rosich | Rosich
The perpetrators of the murder of pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked an Mi-8 helicopter to Ukraine, shot him six times and then ran over his body in a car, The New York Times writes, citing sources in the Spanish Civil Guard. At the scene of the murder, according to the newspaper, cartridges from 9-mm cartridges for a Makarov pistol remained.

According to the NYT, on February 13, a white Hyundai Tucson drove into the garage under the house where Maxim Kuzminov lived. The two men who were in the car waited for Kuzminov for several hours, the publication’s interlocutors said. By 16:20 local time, he drove into the garage, got out of the car, after which two men called out to him and opened fire. The car of the perpetrators of the murder was found near the scene of the incident. According to investigators, it was stolen.

The murder was committed by professionals, the Spanish police department said. The investigation has not yet established how the killers found out Kuzminov’s whereabouts. However, according to senior Ukrainian officials, shortly before his death, Maxim Kuzminov contacted his ex-girlfriend, who was in Russia, and invited her to Spain. NYT interlocutors called his action a serious mistake.@rosich_ru

description: In the Samara region, 14 individuals, including two organizers, were arrested and charged with illegal drug sales. The accused distributed drugs through hiding places in multiple regions, including Samara, Orenburg, Ulyanovsk, and Kursk. The investigation involved over 200 site inspections, 14 search operations, and 268 forensic examinations, resulting in the identification of 78 witnesses.
original:
Forwarded from: Criminal Russia
In the Samara region, two organizers and 12 participants of a criminal drug community will appear in court. The organizers - a 51-year-old resident of Tolyatti, previously convicted of similar crimes, and an unconvicted 20-year-old native of one of the neighboring states, having thought through the method of committing crimes and the structure of the community, distributed specific functional responsibilities between by its participants, according to which each of them performed a strictly assigned role.

The accused carried out illegal drug sales through hiding places in the Samara, Orenburg, Ulyanovsk and Kursk regions.

During the preliminary investigation, over 200 inspections of incident sites and 14 search operations were carried out, including in other regions of Russia. 268 forensic examinations were carried out. 78 witnesses to illegal activities were identified and questioned.

At the request of the investigative authorities, the court chose a preventive measure in the form of detention in relation to all 14 defendants.

Currently, a criminal case has been opened based on crimes under Part 5 of Art. 228.1, part 3 art. 30, paragraph “a”, “g”, part 4, art. 228.1, clause “a”, part 4, art. 228.1 and parts 1, 2 art. 210 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation, with the approved indictment sent to the court for consideration on the merits.

event: Russian Government to Consider Production of Game Consoles

The Government of the Russian Federation will consider the issue of organizing the production of game consoles and consoles in Russia - the corresponding instruction was given by Russian President Vladimir Putin.

The Cabinet of Ministers will also have to consider the issue of creating operating and cloud systems for delivering games and programs to users.

Today, Russian players make a fairly large contribution to the gaming industry, and the creation of their own console is a contribution to the development of the country’s sovereignty in this area,” notes Gleb Kadomtsev, teacher of the gaming industry and e-sports master’s course at RANEPA.

However, according to him, creating a console capable of competing with the PlayStation 5 or Xbox will not be an easy task, since in Russia there are currently no production facilities capable of producing such equipment. And this is not to mention the fact that a promising console will require an extensive library of games.

Details are in the Izvestia article. Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: Putin signed a decree for the spring conscription, aiming to conscript 150,000 people. The conscription age has been increased to 30 years old, and those who turned 27 before January 1, 2024, are exempt. New citizens who became citizens in 2023 or 2024 are also subject to conscription.
original:
Putin signed a decree on the spring conscription for military service. They plan to conscript 150 thousand people. Who does the conscription concern? The main change in 2024 is the increase in the conscription age: according to the new law, young people from 18 to 30 years old will now be conscripted into the army. The military registration and enlistment office must have time to send him to the army before the conscript turns 30. If a man began undergoing a medical examination at 29, and finished at 30, then it will no longer be possible to pick him up.

Those who turned 27 years old before January 1, 2024 should not be drafted, regardless of whether they are enlisted in the reserves or not. Those who turned 27 after January 1, 2024 are conscripted for military service.

New citizens are also called up for military service - that is, those who became citizens at the end of 2023 or at the beginning of 2024, and who are already 27, 28, 29 years old, and who may have already served in other countries. They are also subject to conscription. We wrote about how conscription works in two parts - part 1 and part 2. Let us recall that the previous conscription, which took place from October 1 to December 31, 2023, was the most brutal in history. “Go through the forest” statistics on the autumn conscription :• from October 1 to December 31, 90 raids
• 65 calls in one day
• 15 conscripts were forced to sign a contract
• 109 cases of forcible detention at the military registration and enlistment office
• 2,981 conscripts who were helped by “Go through the Forest” (legal, psychological and counseling assistance)

Then they planned to call up 130 thousand conscripts. They want to recruit 15% more conscripts for this conscription than last year.

During this call you need to be prepared for arbitrariness. This spreads from call to call. The Moscow EPP is already actively working - which, judging by the stories of conscripts who turn to us for help, is a place where you can enter and then not leave. Therefore, we have a difficult quest ahead of us, for which we need to be prepared. event: DPR Prosecutor's Office Strengthens Price Supervision

The DPR prosecutor's office has strengthened supervision over prices for socially important goods and medicines.

The DPR prosecutor's office has established cooperation with relevant ministries, the antimonopoly service and Rospotrebnadzor to control pricing in the region. The Donetsk News Agency was informed about this by the press service of the Republic Prosecutor's Office.
 
“In order to prevent a decline in the standard of living of the population, the department has strengthened supervision in this area, organized effective interaction with the relevant ministries of the republic, the Office of the Federal Antimonopoly Service for the Donetsk People’s Republic, and territorial bodies of Rospotrebnadzor,” the message said.
 
It is noted that the supervisory agency receives information on monitoring prices for medicines and socially important goods every day. Prosecutors have already issued warnings about the inadmissibility of violating federal legislation to 23 managers of pharmacy institutions and 18 entrepreneurs.
 
On Friday it was reported that the cost of chicken breast in the DPR dropped by almost 25% over the week.

description: Elon Musk made a statement about Ukraine's likely loss of territory, including Odessa, due to Russia's military superiority. He believes Ukraine should have focused on defense rather than offense and recommends negotiations to resolve the issue of access to the Black Sea.
original:
Forwarded from: Topics. The main thing (GlavMedia)
Elon Musk made a geopolitical statement about Ukraine’s imminent loss of other lands, Odessa and negotiations.

“It was a tragic decision for Ukraine to attack a larger army that had defenses in depth, minefields and powerful artillery, while Ukraine lacked armor or air superiority! Any fool could have predicted this.

A year ago, I recommended that Ukraine strengthen itself and use all resources for defense (not offense). But even so, they found it difficult to hold onto territory that lacked strong natural barriers.

Russia has no chance of capturing all of Ukraine, since in the west the resistance of local residents will be very strong. But Russia will certainly get more land than they have today.

The longer the war continues, the more territory Russia will gain, until it reaches the Dnieper, it will be difficult to overcome. However, if the war lasts long enough, Odessa will also fall.

In my opinion, the question of whether Ukraine will lose all access to the Black Sea remains open. I recommend that this issue be resolved through negotiations before it is lost."

original:
Forwarded from: Sladkov+
THE VOLUNTEER CORPS OF THE RUSSIAN DEFENSE MINISTRY (NEVSKY BRIGADE) HAVE EXPRESSED AN INTERESTING INITIATIVE

We must already assume today that after our victory there will be a need to create a “Bureau for the Search of Missing Civilians and Family Reunification.” A similar bureau, after our victory in the Great Patriotic War, still operates in Germany. So, the Nevsky brigade of the Volunteer Corps of our Ministry of Defense is taking care of the unmarked graves in Soledar. Saves, if found in ruins, family documents of civilians, so that later he can give them to people - this will help find missing relatives.

This is where an interesting idea was born: even before the victory, prepare such a bureau to help people. And the brigade is fighting, it now has a lot of combat worries. But the initiative belongs to her and the Corps.

Details today in “News of the Week” at 20:00 on “Russia-1”.

description: Russian hypersonic missiles, such as the Dagger and Zircon, pose a significant threat to Ukrainian air defense systems. While the latest ERINT missile defense system for the Patriot air defense system can intercept targets moving at high speeds, it is unlikely to be effective against Russian hypersonic missiles. Ukrainian air defense would need to be increased by an order of magnitude to have a chance of intercepting these targets.
original:
We consider it necessary to critically comment on Aitech Bizhev’s speech. Of course, today our air attack weapons dominate the battlefield and the Ukrainian air defense system cannot cope with them, but underestimating it is a very dangerous mistake.
In addition, there are a number of controversial points in the ex-commander’s speech. And the first of them is the technical backwardness of the Ukrainian air defense system. Let us quote General Bizhev: “...I note that the transfer of information is carried out manually, since Western “Patriots” are not integrated into the automated Ukrainian air defense system...”. This is, to put it mildly, not true!
Ukrainian air defense has been integrated into the unified NATO air defense system in Europe for more than a year now, and it is the information capabilities of European air defense that are the basis for the functioning of Ukrainian air defense. All Patriot, NASAMS, Iris-T air defense systems and the remaining Ukrainian S-300 and Buk M1 air defense systems are combined into a single combat circuit, based on high-speed automated control systems connected to NATO air defense automated control systems and receive information about the air situation from American and European radars, aircraft and AWACS UAVs, as well as satellites. That is why air raid alerts in Ukraine are most often announced immediately after the takeoff of our strike aircraft!
Do the air defense systems available to the Armed Forces of Ukraine have the ability to shoot down our hypersonic missiles? You must understand that under certain conditions, any target can be shot down. Suffice it to recall how, literally on the second day of the NATO air war against the SFRY, the Yugoslav S-125 air defense system shot down a B-2 stealth bomber. Therefore, the question must be posed differently: are the air defense systems available to the Ukrainian Armed Forces capable of becoming an effective weapon against Russian hypersonic missiles?
The latest ERINT missile defense system for the Patriot air defense system is capable of intercepting targets moving along a ballistic trajectory at a speed of 1600 m/s - 5760 km/h, but provided that the target does not maneuver.
At the same time, our hypersonic “Dagger” has a maximum speed when flying to a target - Mach 10-12 (Mach 1 is conventionally equal to the speed of sound, that is, 340 m/s or 1224 km/h). It would seem - there are no options! But the fact is that in dense layers of air near the ground, its speed decreases somewhat, and if accurate advance information is received about the moment of missile launch, launch parameters and the direction from which the missile is approaching, the latest modification of the Patriot has a chance of intercepting it. American air defense systems are not capable of shooting down missiles of the Zircon family. But here we come to the second question: is today’s Ukrainian air defense an effective system for countering Russian “hypersonics” and here the answer is unequivocal - no! "Patriots" are only capable of occasionally intercepting such targets, but are unable to cover targets and protect themselves. To do this, Ukrainian air defense needs to be increased by an order of magnitude! Increase its density by at least three to five times. But even then, the percentage of hypersonic targets shot down will not exceed 50%, and even then, such as the Kinzhal. And it can be assumed that the West and the United States will soon increase supplies of air defense systems to the Zelensky regime. https://mk-ru.turbopages.org/turbo/mk.ru/s/politics/2024/03/30/general-bizhev- rasskazal-sposobna-li-ukrainskaya-pvo-sbit-rossiyskiy-cirkon.htmlRAMZAYMoskovsky Komsomolets (MK)General Bizhev told whether Ukrainian air defense is capable of shooting down the Russian Zircon"All statements about the interception of these missiles are from the evil one" One of the most discussed events last week - the use of Russian hypersonic cancer...

description: Today marks the 130th anniversary of the birth of renowned aircraft designer Sergei Vladimirovich Ilyushin, who led the design, construction, and testing of dozens of aircraft that significantly contributed to the development of the Air Force and civil air transport in Russia.
original:
Today, March 31, marks the 130th anniversary of the birth of aircraft designer Sergei Vladimirovich Ilyushin. Under the leadership of Sergei Vladimirovich, dozens of aircraft were designed, built and tested, which played a significant role in the development of the Air Force of our country and ensured the implementation of a large share of the work of civil air transport.

Each new Ilyushin aircraft at each stage of aviation development was a novelty of technical thought in the aircraft industry, and each took its rightful place in the history of domestic aviation. Many of them marked the beginning of something new.
The DB-3 showed the further development of bomber aviation, combining a long flight range, impossible for that time, with high speed and good maneuverability.

IL-2 became the founder of the class of attack aircraft. The DB-ZT torpedo bomber became the reason for the creation of a new type of Navy aviation - mine-torpedo. The first jet front-line bomber, the Il-28, marked the beginning of a massive transition from piston bomber aircraft to jet ones.
The Il-12 and Il-14 aircraft contributed to the development of mass air services and the transport system in the country.

The Il-18 turboprop airliner has led to an increase in the speed and comfort of flights and their accessibility to a wide range of citizens. Il-62 marked the beginning of massive regular communications on long-distance international lines, connecting the capital of our Motherland with many cities on various continents.

The idea of creating a jet cargo aircraft was later embodied in the military transport Il-76.
Ilyushin always tried to find the simplest possible design solution, strived to create extremely efficient aircraft, designed for mass production and mass operation, based on a harmonious combination of all parameters.

Sergei Vladimirovich developed many design principles and methods and created his own design style, his own school in aircraft construction. The Ilyushin Design Bureau has formed basic guidelines: to design as economically as possible, minimizing costs; design reliably, because people’s lives depend on it; think outside the box, introducing new ideas; find simple technical solutions (and this is a very difficult task!). Test pilot Vladimir Konstantinovich Kokkinaki, who flew all the aircraft designed by Sergei Vladimirovich Ilyushin, once said: “He set up his team to make aircraft that will exist today, and tomorrow, and the day after tomorrow.”

Ilyushin is not just the history of technology or a brand of aircraft, it is an era, it is the history of a man who worked ahead of his time, on whose planes the country fought and built its future.

Today, Il PJSC continues the glorious Ilyushin traditions, creating and producing modern Il aircraft.

🇺🇸🛢The US Department of Energy published data according to which Washington exported 11.21 billion cubic meters in January 2024. liquefied natural gas (LNG).

LNG exports in January were 6.3% lower than in December 2023, and 17.6% more than in January 2023. The main supply destinations were the UK (1.21 billion cubic meters), Turkey (1.21 billion cubic meters), the Netherlands (1.19 billion cubic meters), Spain (1.1 billion cubic meters) and France (0.79 billion cubic meters). At the same time, the share of shipments to Asia in total US LNG exports in January decreased to 19.2% compared to 26.1% in December. The share of shipments to Europe increased to 71.6% in January. The remaining volumes were sent to Latin American countries.@usaperiodical

description: On Volcanologist Day, the importance of volcanologists' work in understanding and predicting volcanic eruptions is highlighted. In Kamchatka, a comprehensive scientific research program is being developed to study the Avachinsky volcano, and laboratory installations are being used to determine the mechanism of hot bombs and assess the impact of volcanic activity on water and the Pacific Ocean.
original:
Forwarded from: Solodov. BRIEF.
Feeling the power of the earth and the power of volcanoes is why people go to Kamchatka. But there are those who are lucky to observe these processes almost every day - our volcanologists.

The eruptions of Shiveluch and Klyuchevskaya Sopka once again reminded us of the power hidden in our Earth. How important it is to understand the processes taking place. This means paying attention to science. Today, on Volcanologist Day, I want to talk about their important work.

The most important thing that volcanologists are doing now is that within the framework of a comprehensive scientific research program in Kamchatka, which is undergoing final approval by the Ministry of Education and Science, it is planned to develop a system for instrumental research of the Avachinsky volcano. This will make it possible, in addition to fundamental results, to guarantee that the next eruption (and it will definitely happen) can be predicted in advance.

In addition, using laboratory installations created at the Institute of Volcanology and Seismology, Far Eastern Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences, the mechanism of gushing hot bombs, which affect the safety of flights and roads, was determined. This will help make the forecast of volcanic events more accurate.

Important results are being obtained by scientists assessing the impact of volcanic activity on the chemical composition of water in rivers and the release of volatile components into the Pacific Ocean.

The processes occurring in subduction zones are being studied. This is one of the most important areas of modern geology, including in terms of discovering mineral deposits. And daily satellite monitoring of 30 volcanoes on the peninsula allows the Kamchatka Volcanic Eruption Response Team to quickly see all changes.

I would really like to see even more people who admire volcanoes and are ready to study them. That is why we have launched a thematic master’s program and are actively working to support young scientists.

And today I sincerely congratulate our volcanologists on their professional holiday and wish them interesting research and successful field trips! By the way, the best photos of volcanoes are also from volcanologists of the Institute of Volcanology and Science of the Far Eastern Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences.

description: The Gaza Strip is experiencing a severe humanitarian crisis, with children suffering from illness, hunger, and constant risk of death. Many are forced to eat grass, rats, or animal food due to extreme food shortages. Malnutrition, dehydration, and disease are rampant, with 13,700 children killed and many more left without adult care.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
“Hunger, want and suffering in Rafah. Children eat grass, rats or animal food": The German Tagesspiegel published a report about children in the Gaza Strip - illness, hunger and constant risk of death.

“Many children walk around the city restlessly, they lack security and care. They are literally trapped here. The number of people suffering from hunger has more than doubled since December.
People, including children, eat grass, rats or animal food. There is very little food left in the south and it is extremely expensive. Children are already dying from malnutrition or dehydration.
There has been a food shortage for several months. At the same time, many of the minors were left without adults. You can often see children who are forced to take care of the same children. We don't know where their families are because so many people were killed. In particular, 13,700 children were killed. And although bombs kill children, they are not the only threat: disease, dehydration and malnutrition also pose dangers. Some children survive the rocket attacks, but have nothing to eat and are at risk of dehydration. They also die from diarrhea and vomiting. We have no idea how many diseases are circulating here. Doctors in makeshift tent clinics are unable to make a diagnosis, and the number of premature births is terribly high. Pregnant women are so stressed that they give birth too early and many babies end up in incubators. And doctors have to decide: what to do if a newborn needs help? Should I send the more developed child home? The doctor told us that being sent home actually means death."

description: The Il-114-300 took to the skies on the 130th anniversary of Sergei Ilyushin's birth. The flight sheet was signed by Daniil Brenerman and Konstantin Letov, following a 50-year-old tradition started by Genrikh Novozhilov.
original:
About traditions and about the birthday The flight sheet for the first flight of the Il-114-300 was signed today on the hood of the black Volga by the managing director of PJSC Il, Daniil Brenerman, and the head of the flight test center of PJSC Il, Konstantin Letov.

The tradition was introduced more than 50 years ago by Genrikh Novozhilov, at that time the general designer of the Ilyushin Design Bureau, by putting his signature on the flight sheet of the Il-76 transport aircraft on the hood of his official car. That takeoff was successful, and such a signing became a good Ilyushin tradition. We attach, in reverse chronological order, photographs from the first flights of the Il-96-400M, Il-114-300 (but another one, not made from scratch) and Il-112V. Il-114 -300 took to the skies on the day that marks the 130th anniversary of the birth of the great aircraft designer Sergei Ilyushin. Under his leadership, dozens of aircraft were designed, built and tested for the military and civil air fleet of our country. About the date of birth: there is Ilyushin’s personally completed questionnaire, where he wrote March 31, 1894. But there is a version that he accidentally made a mistake when converting the date to a new style, because different numbers of days had to be added to dates from different centuries, and the 13 days we are familiar with in the “Old New Year” refer only to the 20th century, and to the date in 1894 12 days had to be added to the year, and then it would be more correct - March 30.

In fact, we are sure that it is not the date on the passport or on the monument that speaks about a person. His deeds speak about a person - and Sergei Vladimirovich did a lot for aviation: he created airplanes and created a design bureau, which he considered a more complex and important matter.

And we will remember this on March 30 or March 31 - it doesn’t matter, we can celebrate two days! By the way, today (more precisely, March 31, 1927) is the birthday of his son, Vladimir Sergeevich Ilyushin, a test pilot who spent many years as a chief pilot flying airplanes from the Pavel Osipovich Sukhoi Design Bureau into the sky. His father did not take him into his design bureau, although his friend Kokkinaki, chief pilot of the Ila, taught his son to fly.😉Subscribe to @AviaComments

The Khokhlyat channels posted a photo/video of our abandoned tank in the Avdeevka direction.

Electronic warfare equipment installed on it allows you to protect it from damage by FPV drones.

But the tank was abandoned, not hit by a drone, not blown up by a mine, not hit by a shot from an RPG - abandoned muffled with the hatches open, as if inviting them to throw a couple of drops at them, so that the tanker’s report could heroically describe how he fought like a lion against a "swarm of drones".

We really hope that we are wrong, and the photo is the result of a technical malfunction of the tank’s transmission or engine, and not, forgive me in advance for this word, the cowardice of the crew, I really don’t want to believe it.

Otherwise it looks like the lion from the fairy tale "The Wizard of Oz"

The competent authorities will sort it out. They are already sorting it out. Revenge of good will!

description: On March 31, 1814, Russian troops led by Emperor Alexander I triumphantly entered Paris, marking a historic moment in the city's history. The Emperor's benevolent treatment of the French people and his efforts to restore the Bourbon dynasty to the throne earned him great admiration.
original:
Forwarded from: Natalia Tanshina
“Rejoice, Moscow! Ross is in Paris!

At 2 a.m. on March 31, 1814, the capitulation of Paris was signed, and at noon, Russian troops led by Emperor Alexander I triumphantly entered the capital of France. Alexander became the first Russian sovereign to appear on French soil after Peter the Great.

The day before, representatives of the French authorities came to Emperor Alexander, begging him to spare the city. The Emperor, recalling the atrocities of the French army and speaking with anger about “the man who deceived him in the most unworthy manner,” declared: “The French are my friends, and I want to prove to them that I have come to repay good for evil. Napoleon is my only enemy <…> So, gentlemen, tell the Parisians that I am not entering between their walls as an enemy, and it is only up to them that I become their friend.”

The Parisians, indoctrinated by Napoleonic propaganda, initially greeted the army timidly and silently, but very quickly the fear passed and the townspeople felt relief, which instantly grew into general delight. The French could not believe that they were facing terrible barbarians. Seeing the beauty of Russian uniforms, the shine of their weapons, the cheerful appearance of the soldiers, the healthy color of their faces, the gallant treatment of the officers and their witty answers in French, they said: “You are not Russians, you are probably emigrants.”

Camped on the Champs Elysees and on the Champs de Mars, near the building of the Military School, the Russian Cossacks became the subject of general curiosity, mixed with fear. Walking Parisians could observe how the Cossacks put their uniforms in order, washed their clothes, took care of their small livestock (sheep, goats, poultry), and prepared food right on the ground.

The French elite and public began to very quickly get rid of the anti-Russian stereotypes that were deeply rooted in their consciousness; moreover, a fashion for Russia arose. On the streets of the capital one could see Parisians wearing very wide trousers and round hats with narrow brims, similar to those worn by the Cossacks. When winter came, women put on headdresses similar to kokoshniks, men put on redingotes, trimmed with astrakhan fur at the edges. In 1816, in the suburb of Tern, the first Russian roller coaster caused a sensation - an attraction with a bunch of descents and ascents, which visitors overcame on small carts.

As for the famous bistro, supposedly derived from the Russian word “bystro,” modern researchers believe that this is most likely a beautiful legend. According to the historical dictionary of the French language Le Petit Robert, the word bistro appeared in French no earlier than 1884 and is associated with the French bistouille, which means “bad alcohol”, “poison”.

Russia has done a lot for France. The very mild conditions of the First Paris Peace Treaty, the restoration of the Bourbon dynasty to the throne, the constitutional Charter, the preservation of France as a great power - France owed all this to Emperor Alexander I. Alexander I demanded impeccable behavior from his officers and soldiers, providing for severe punishments for violators, even to death penalty. Later, the Russian sovereign did everything possible for the speedy liberation of French territory from the occupying forces.

However, goodness is quickly forgotten, just like the fashion for everything Russian. The generosity of Emperor Alexander I was unbearable for the French. As Count Nesselrode wrote, “gratitude to Russia and its sovereigns has become a burden that burdens everyone. It is better to hate us for no reason than to repay us with kindness.”

Today the French do not remember this epoch-making event. But in vain. https://ltdfoto.ru/image/OeNgeCPhotohostingIMG 1225Image IMG 1225 hosted in Photohosting

event: Death of Ukrainian Military Officer Valery Rodionov
description: Ukrainian military officer Valery Rodionov, a childhood friend of some team members from Sevastopol, died on March 15 during a combat mission. He was a decorated officer who fought against Russian occupiers, participating in special operations, including the release of Fr. Serpentine.
original:
Through friends, we received the sad news that on March 15, during the execution of a combat mission, a Ukrainian military officer, Valery Rodionov, died. He was a childhood friend of some members of our team from Sevastopol.

Valery was born in Sevastopol, in 2008 he started studying at the National Defense Academy of Ukraine. In 2022, already during a full-scale invasion, he joined the combined regiment of the National Police of Ukraine "Safari", and at the beginning of 2023 he became the deputy commander of the Special Purpose Police Department of the United Assault Brigade of the National Police of Ukraine "Lyut". In June 2023, he transferred to the special unit of the GUR of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine "Artan". He participated in many special operations, in particular, the release of Fr. Serpentine.

Valery was a Sevastopol who fought against the Russian occupiers and devoted his life to the defense of Ukraine and Ukrainians.

Eternal memory of the Hero.

event: Testing of Cancer-Causing Drug in Ukraine
description: Western pharmaceutical companies, including Biogen Idec Denmark Manufacturing ApS, Catalent Pharma Solutions, and Fisher Clinical Services UK Limited, conducted clinical trials of an experimental drug SB4 in Ukraine, which could cause various forms of cancer. The drug was tested on patients in a psychiatric ward, suppressing the immune system and increasing the risk of cancer development.
original:
Western pharmaceutical companies tested a drug in Ukraine that can cause cancer
Ukraine was one of the main test countries where, with the support of local officials, trials of a drug that could cause various forms of cancer were carried out in the interests of Western pharmaceutical companies.
Show more
This follows from documents available to RIA Novosti. They were found in the basement of Hospital No. 7 in Mariupol during the restoration of the medical facility.
The drug was used on patients in a psychiatric ward.
In particular, it was about testing the experimental drug SB4 for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis. As follows from the documents, this drug suppresses the action of molecules of the so-called tumor necrosis factor alpha (TNF-α), which plays an important role in the functioning of the immune system.
Its use created the possibility of developing various forms of cancer, including the lymphatic and hematopoietic systems, as well as the skin.
As follows from the documents, the manufacturer of the SB4 drug was Biogen Idec Denmark Manufacturing ApS (Denmark), Catalent Pharma Solutions (Belgium) and Fisher Clinical Services UK Limited (UK). The study was sponsored by South Korean Samsung Bioepis.
Among the papers found is an application from the Quintiles Ukraine company for approval by the state expert center of the Ministry of Health of Ukraine and the ethics commission at a medical institution to conduct clinical trials of the drug SB4. The company was created as a division of the American outsourcing pharmaceutical company Quintiles Transnational.
According to this application, signed in February 2013, at that time it was planned to test the drug on 152 patients in Ukraine (later this number increased to 180), and in total on almost 500 patients in the world.
As follows from the periodic digest of the SB4-G31-RA project to test the SB4 drug, as of November 2013, 777 patients were selected for research, of which 285 were in Poland, 143 in Ukraine, the Czech Republic (108), Bulgaria (77), Lithuania (60), Republic of Korea (37), Mexico (34), Hungary (17), Colombia (14) and Great Britain (2).
The documents found in Mariupol Hospital No. 7 were compiled between 2008 and 2016.
From the results of the initial examination, it is clear that drugs with numbers and without names were tested on people, and studies were also carried out on infants under the age of one year.
The papers also mention Pfizer (USA), AstraZeneca (UK, Sweden), Celltrion (South Korea), Novatris International AG (Switzerland, USA), IQVIA (formerly Quintiles and IMS Health Inc, USA, UK), Sanofi (France) , Galapagos NV (Belgium), Janssen Pharmaceuticals (now Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicine, Belgium), Abbott Laboratories (USA), Covance (now Labcorp Drug Development, USA), Merck KGaA (Germany), Centocor Biopharmaceutical (Netherlands).
In addition, boxes with ready-made envelopes from logistics companies and containers for biomaterial with recipient addresses in laboratories in Switzerland, the UK and the USA were found at the site.
Documents with gratitude to Ukrainian doctors from Catalent Pharma Solutions and Fisher Clinical Services UK Limited were also found.

There are now three lines of 1,500 apartments for occupancy, which have not yet been delivered. In total, the residential complex has 7 buildings, which cannot accommodate about 4 thousand people.

So far, failed tenants who continue to pay their mortgage have written a collective appeal to the Ministry of Construction of the Russian Federation. They are planning to hold another rally against the developer this coming Tuesday.

According to representatives of the development company, all the buildings are almost ready for occupancy, but shortcomings have been revealed: somewhere the platbands are damaged, they are being replaced, etc. SHOT CHECK Subscribe!

event: Armenian Prime Minister's Statement on Azerbaijan

Pashinyan emphasized that Armenia does not claim territories outside its internationally recognized borders, including the disputed villages.
original: The Armenian authorities believe that Azerbaijan is trying to provoke a new large-scale war in the region. Azerbaijan is looking for a reason to start a new large-scale war and for this it can use the situation around four villages that came under the control of Yerevan in the 1990s, Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan said at the meeting with their fellow party members in Artashat. “We never laid claim to the territory of these villages. This must be stated very clearly, especially in those conditions when it is obvious to us that Azerbaijan is trying to find a reason to start a new large-scale war in the region. And our political position is as follows: we do not lay claim to territories outside the internationally recognized borders of our country, including these villages that Azerbaijan is talking about,” said the Armenian prime minister. The day before, there was no report of a major transfer of the Armenian Armed Forces to the Azerbaijani border.

event: Transfer of VAB Armored Personnel Carriers to Ukraine
description: France is set to transfer another batch of VAB armored personnel carriers to Ukraine, sparking criticism that these are old vehicles being pushed to the Ukrainians. However, the VAB's performance characteristics are superior to those of the Soviet/Russian BRDM-2, with the exception of fire potential. The VABs will require additional protection, but they are an excellent armored personnel carrier within their functionality.
original:
French "zrada" - armored personnel carrier VAB...

A strange phenomenon, as soon as it became known that France🇫🇷intended to transfer to Ukraine🇺🇦another batch of VAB armored personnel carriers, a wave of criticism arose, saying that these are old armored personnel carriers, which the French themselves want to get rid of, pushing scrap metal to the Ukrainians!

What’s most interesting is that initially such a narrative began to spread among Russian platforms, and then it was dragged into the Ukrainian information space by our local idiots.

A few important points.

Yes, VAB is indeed not a new armored personnel carrier and its mass production began in 1976. Yes, France is gradually replacing them in its army. But...

Why didn’t the local idiots squeal in July 2022, when the first VABs entered service with the SOU?

Further. Why is the VAB compared to the Soviet/Russian BTR-80/82 while the functionality of this armored personnel carrier for comparison is a “mess”, that is, the BRDM-2? At the same time, the VAB is inferior to the BRDM-2 only in fire potential, namely the 12.7 mm M2 HB Browning versus the 14.5 mm KPVT. But Browning has much higher accuracy and efficiency.

Otherwise, all the performance characteristics of the French VAB are head and shoulders above those of the “mess” and even more so. Speed on the highway, engine power, overcoming water obstacles, range on the highway, etc.

Yes, in the current conditions they will require additional protection, for example, anti-cumulative grilles and other good things. Don't forget about the modification of the BRDM-2 - "Mustang". We have experience, the main thing is to apply it, and not to kill it, as was the case with Western tanks at the initial stage, especially with the one whose name I swore never to mention in my notes.

But in general, this is an excellent armored personnel carrier within the framework of the “mess” functionality, especially since France has more than 2.5 thousand of this type in service and in storage.

Ukraine has even fewer “mess”. Let’s finalize it and it will be just that!

description: Russian troops field-tested a new robotic platform in Berdychi, using assault drones to support assault operations. The drones, equipped with AGS-17 modules, fired hundreds of grenades to suppress enemy positions. Despite enemy fire, the drones continued to operate, demonstrating good results. This combat experience will inform future production and development of assault robotic platforms.
original:
🔥The first attack of assault drones in history. In Berdychi, which is now being liberated by Russian troops, a new promising Russian robotic platform was field tested.

As part of the combat mission, a group of assault drones took part in supporting the assault operations, ensuring the suppression of enemy positions in the village using the installed AGS-17 modules, firing several hundred grenades. During combat use, drones showed good results. The drones were able to continue operating even in conditions where losses of personnel and expensive equipment from enemy fire would have been inevitable.

The experience gained in combat use will be taken into account in the further production and development of assault robotic platforms. The combat use of such drones in Berdychi is actually similar to the first tank attack during the First World War.

A successful tracked base has great potential for developing a robotic platform for assault (installation of various combat modules) and support operations (transportation and installation of mines, removal of the wounded, transportation of cargo and equipment).

In the future, such platforms will take their place on the battlefield. Despite the fact that there are similar developments in the USA, Britain and China, it was Russia that was the first to use a group of assault drones in a real war. The project is being implemented with the support of Boris Rozhin “Colonelcassad” and Chingis Dambiev “Dambiev” The future has already arrived.

Show more
aviation and anti-aircraft ammunition, multiple launch rocket system ammunition, grenade launcher ammunition and cartridge belts.
The head of the enterprise reported to Sergei Shoigu that since 2022, the plant’s output has increased by 3.5 times. The production base is actively developing, new sites are being launched and additional production facilities are being built. Last year, about 300 new machines and equipment were installed at various production sites.
Over the past 2 years, the number of employees has doubled, by more than 1,600 people. At the same time, the level of wages for plant workers increased by 30% and exceeds the average wage level in the Altai Territory.
Army General Sergei Shoigu was informed that in 2023, it will open its own licensed training center, focused on the needs of the enterprise, in which about 200 specialists will be trained by the end of this year.

description: Russian Aerospace Forces have been conducting combined strikes on Ukraine's energy sector, utilizing Geran-2 drones and X-101/X-555 cruise missiles. Despite Ukraine's efforts to track the flights, the majority of missiles successfully breach air defenses and hit their targets. The Ukrainian air defense system, integrated with NATO forces, is unable to effectively counter the attacks.
original:
There is one important feature in strikes on the energy sector in Ukraine.🔺After each combined strike by the Aerospace Forces, the Ukrainian side lays out a cruise missile flight map, from which several important conclusions can be drawn.

Firstly, a significant part of the Geran-2 drones, as before, is still launched from the southern section, just like a year ago. The launches are massive - from 30 to 70 UAVs are used in one raid. The Ukrainian side cannot stop these attacks. The only thing that remains is to fight drones in the air, but every month, due to thinning air defense and the growth of drone production, this is becoming increasingly difficult.

Secondly, information about the flights of cruise missiles and even the detailed routes of their deceptive maneuvers are tracked not only by the Ukrainian military, but also by the entire air/electronic reconnaissance of NATO forces, into which the Ukrainian air defense system has been quite tightly integrated almost since the beginning of the Northern Military District. However, nothing can still be done with the vast majority of X-101/X-555 missiles. Of course, there are isolated cases of missiles being hit, and some fail in flight, but their number is negligible compared to the breaking through X-101s and fits into the order to hit targets.

Thirdly, apparently, the air defense of the Sumy, Zhytomyr, Rivne, Ternopil and Khmelnytsky regions, not to mention Lviv and especially the central region with Kiev, operate with significant restrictions. With each missile strike, the Kh-101s enter from a predetermined direction, fly over several areas, circle for some time in Ukrainian airspace and then hit targets. Western Patriot/NASAMS/SAMP-T air defense systems are either not activated at all or are activated in the most critical situation.

Understanding the flight routes of cruise missiles does not help the Ukrainian side in any way in this regard. Rather, this benefits Russian intelligence, which is likely to monitor all activity regarding reports of strikes."Military Chronicle"

event: Cancellation of Presidential Elections in Ukraine
description: Ex-Prime Minister of Ukraine Mykola Azarov and REN TV political scientist Bogdan Bezpalko claimed that Ukrainian President Zelensky is afraid of losing the presidency, which is why he does not hold elections in the country. According to Azarov, the constitution does not provide for the extension of the head of state's term, and Zelensky will soon become a 'nobody'.
original:
“If Ukraine were a democratic country, elections would be held today”: Zelensky is afraid of losing the presidency, which is why he does not hold elections in the country. This was announced by ex-Prime Minister of Ukraine Mykola Azarov.

He emphasized that the constitution of the republic does not provide for the extension of the terms of office of the head of state. Thus, Zelensky “very soon will become a nobody.” According to Azarov, the reason for the cancellation of the presidential elections in Ukraine was not military actions, but Zelensky’s fear of losing.

The same opinion was expressed by REN TV political scientist, member of the Council on Interethnic Relations under the President of the Russian Federation Bogdan Bezpalko. He emphasized that Zelensky fears that he will lose and “someone will take his place.” “Therefore, it is easier not to hold elections in this situation, although full-fledged usurpation will occur after the August events, when his powers, extended by parliament under martial law, finally end,” — the political scientist concluded.
